title: Responsiveness of Flash vs responsiveness of damage
body:
Flash is a very responsive ability, and I love it. Sometimes it's even more responsive than damage.

Getting killed by a melee attack after flashing out of it feels wrong. Yes, that's how the mechanics work, and you should've flashed before they even started their attack animation, but it still feels icky.

replies.body: If moving out of range canceled every melee attack, melee would never get a hit on moving targets. This simple way of handling the attacks prevents an enormous problem.

There should be a limit on it. For example, if you move more than 50 units in one frame (so any instantaneous movement, like Flash) then the attack fails. Maybe even make Flash a "perfect defense" against everything except skillshots-- disjoint any projectiles targeted at the caster.

> There should be a limit on it. For example, if you move more than 50 units in one frame (so any instantaneous movement, like Flash) then the attack fails. Maybe even make Flash a "perfect defense" against everything except skillshots-- disjoint any projectiles targeted at the caster.

It sounds like you want flash to dodge all projectiles except for skillshots.

No.

Thats how flash used to work and that was its one of its biggest problems is that having flash meant you could dodge any and all hits that would kill you and i hated that aspect of flash as many others did. Hell i hate it now because its the single best summoner spell in the game and not taking will gimp whatever champ your playing doesnt matter who.
Ahh, I didn't realize that this was the old implementation. It's just always seemed weird to me that teleportation doesn't stop an arrow from hitting you, is all.
yeah but i dont think that it would require rewriting the code of the entire game to make flash cancel meele autoatacks
Melees autoatacking and killing somebody after they Flashed feels wrong though. But yes this is true
if they are in the beginning phases of the windup it wont hit. if you get hit like that... you flashed halfway through their attack animation

Even worse is when you flash, and a Darius somehow pulls you back with his E despite the flash occurring before the pull, or flashing away from a Darius ulti, and it still hitting you even though he is slamming that axe down onto thin air. I agree though. It feels wrong especially with basic attacks. Flash has such a long cool down you'd think they could just give it to you, or make you immune during the frames at least.

Technically, this one is a problem specific to Darius. The grab targets seem to be evaluated on the first frame of his pull, even before he sticks his axe out, so even if you use a skill and flash to escape, it still pulls you back.

Here's a video: http://youtu.be/_4x3dXai7vo
Lol! XD Interesting video. Thanks for the share. I wish they would change it though. It's kind of unfair that the grab catches during the first frame like that.

{{champion:106}} and {{champion:27}} throw-backs do the same thing; though they're a bit harder to catch thanks to the shorter animation.

You should try spell shielding Master Yi's alpha strike.
It procs on targets *before* the animation starts. Plays the animation. *THEN*, deals damage. (o_O)

There are a few other abilities that don't mechanically match their animations, though I can' recall them off the top of my head.

If anything about LoL has ever pissed me off..

It wasn't bad teammates
It wasn't toxic players
It wasn't the servers going down

It was this right here. Flashing then dieing at your new location.

While I understand this completely, I do however find it reasonable for a projectile/ranged auto attack still travel through. However when it comes to melee attacks, thats where things gets frustrating and it disregards the responsiveness. So even though you want to be precise and "dodge" his attack, you will still be hit because lol no reason.
also, precise exchanges don't include flashing out. if you flash out of a fight you lose.
unless you also ignited them, in which case you burned 2 summoners for a kill and the jungler is about to kill you
if you were precise  you would in fact dodge his attack. however, if they have a high attack speed this is nearly impossible to do
The mechanics can never be removed for it would break a lot of abilities/things from working properly honestly.
like when people flash away from  a garen's q and still get hit. i love that still :)
buff flash??? lol
Just be thankful they dont make you spend 2.25k gold to flash

why so ranged trash can suck at A moving even more and not get punished even more?
oh boy
more ADC buffs guys.
yay.
wat
Flash is already too fucking safe, this is fine deal with it.

wanna know how to solve the problem? Grant a small invulnerability frame (less than a second) after flashing.

It would also allow for flash to counterplay a few things, such as Karthus's R, fizz's fish, and Zed's ult burst - and above all it would mean no more dying after skillfully flashing a killing blow.
